definition: to suffer a calamity/to suffer (e.g. under torture)/distress
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
sufferer/a victim of a calamity/a person in distress

sentences.english: Their birthday is on the mother's suffering.
sentences.chinese: 自己的生日就是母亲的受难日。

sentences.english: It says they also tried to silence the victims' relatives with bribes and threats.
sentences.chinese: 并且威逼利诱受难者家属保持沉默。

sentences.english: Many retailers offer online deals for Black Friday.
sentences.chinese: 很多零售商人会在耶稣受难日提供网上交易。

sentences.english: The government doles out something to help the victims.
sentences.chinese: 政府发放了一些救济物品来帮助受难者。

sentences.english: The savior is also recurrently crucified.
sentences.chinese: 救世主也总是一再受难。

sentences.english: Do not argue with the person if he/she disagrees with you.
sentences.chinese: 不要和受难者争论，如果你们意见不一了。

sentences.english: Skepticism is the sadism of embittered souls.
sentences.chinese: 怀疑主义是受难灵魂的自虐。

sentences.english: Many years ago a group of confessors built this church.
sentences.chinese: 很多年以前，一群不畏受难的基督徒修建了这座教堂。

sentences.english: Offering to help the accident victims seems as instinctive as breathing.
sentences.chinese: 对意外受难者的帮助就象呼吸一样出于本能。

sentences.english: The woman followed the men to suffer without complaint.
sentences.chinese: 而女人就无怨无悔地跟着男人受苦受难。

sentences.english: So the suffering Son of God is part of Mark's Christology.
sentences.chinese: 因此神之子的受难就是马可的基督论的一部分。

sentences.english: Dig up lots of massacre victims?
sentences.chinese: 挖了一堆大屠杀受难者出来？

sentences.english: They provided some necessary support for the sufferers.
sentences.chinese: 他们为受难者提供了一些必要的援助。

sentences.english: We heard piteous sounds of suffering and pain.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到可怜的痛苦受难的呻吟。

sentences.english: Then they returned home to the Rue des Filles -du-Calvaire.
sentences.chinese: 然后他们回到受难修女街家中。

sentences.english: The highest percentage of victim injuries was from blunt trauma and burns.
sentences.chinese: 受难者受伤的最高机率就是硬物外伤和烧伤。

definition: to meet with disaster/killed/in the clutches of the enemy/to fall foul of/in danger
sufferer/a victim of a calamity/a person in distress
to die in an accident/to die for a just cause
destitute and homeless (idiom); forced from one's home and wandering about/displaced
to sacrifice oneself in a just cause/a victim of a disaster
to die for a just cause
to die in an accident or disaster/to be killed
